Package model

Class SimpleGameData

java.lang.Object
model.SimpleGameData
public class SimpleGameData
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SimpleGameData()
    Creates all the game's data: the deck, a list of players, the field, the discard zone, and the blue and red tokens

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleGameData

      public SimpleGameData()
      Creates all the game's data: the deck, a list of players, the field, the discard zone, and the blue and red tokens

  • Method Details

    • addCardToDeck

      public void addCardToDeck​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> deck, FireworkColor color, int value, int n)
      Used to generate the deck. Add n times a card with the color and value as argument in the deck
      Parameters:
      deck - deck in which the cards shall be aded
      color - color of the card
      value - value of the card
      n - number of times the card should be added

    • draw

      public Card draw()
      Return a card drawed (removed from the top of the deck). If the deck is empty, we can't draw and return a null (no card)
      Returns:
      Card card drawed

    • lastTurn

      public boolean lastTurn()
      Check if the current game is on it's last turn by checking if the deck is empty. If it is, we are in the last turn.
      Returns:
      boolean true if last turn, false if not

    • getRedTokens

      public int getRedTokens()
      Returns the number of red tokens availables
      Returns:
      int number of red tokens

    • getBlueTokens

      public int getBlueTokens()
      Returns the number of blue tokens availables
      Returns:
      int number of blue tokens

    • getDeck

      public java.util.ArrayList<Card> getDeck()
      Returns the deck
      Returns:
      ArrayList the deck

    • getField

      public java.util.Map<FireworkColor,​java.lang.Integer> getField()
      Returns the field
      Returns:
      Map the field

    • getDiscardZone

      public java.util.Map<FireworkColor,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> getDiscardZone()
      Return the discard zone
      Returns:
      Map the discard zone

    • getPlayers

      public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
      Return a list with all players
      Returns:
      List list of all players

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player player)
      Add a player to the data's list of players
      Parameters:
      player - player added

    • addBlueToken

      public void addBlueToken()
      Add a blue token for the players to use. Since 8 tokens is the maximum, if we already have 8 tokens, no tokens are added

    • removeBlueToken

      public void removeBlueToken()
      Remove a blue tokken to be used

    • addRedToken

      public void addRedToken()
      Add a red token

    • isSetComplete

      public boolean isSetComplete()
      If all stack of cards is complete (the top card of all stacks is 5), returns true
      Returns:
      boolean true if set complete, false if not

    • score

      public int score()
      returns the score of the field
      Returns:
      int Final score

    • addToField

      public void addToField​(Card c)
      Plays a card on the field
      Parameters:
      c - Card player to the field

    • addToDiscardZone

      public void addToDiscardZone​(Card c)
      Discard a card by giving its value to the right color stack
      Parameters:
      c - Discarded card

    • getListWithoutPlayer

      public java.util.List<Player> getListWithoutPlayer​(Player player)
      Returns the list of players without the player given as arguments
      Parameters:
      player - - the player which should not appear in the list
      Returns:
      List The list of players without the player in parameter
